text: How many years have you been in clinical practice?
For the next 100 patients you see, how many do you expect in each of the following (mutually exclusive) groups?
For the next 100 patients you see, how many do you expect in each of the following (mutually exclusive) groups?
What percent of your T2DM patients were PREVIOUSLY managed by another doctor for their diabetes before they were transferred to your care (for diabetes)?

Among those patients referred to you by primary care physicians, why do you think they were transferred to your care? Please arrange the following reasons in the order of their importance, starting with the most important at the top.

options.text: The patient has complicated diabetes that is difficult to manage (regardless of current control status)
Referral to a board-certified endocrinologist reduces medical liability
The patient requested to be seen by a diabetes specialist

text: Of the patients you regularly manage for T2DM, what percent initially presented as newly diagnosed cases of T2DM with no previous medications?
Among the new patients that you see, how many of them have uncontrolled T2DM?
What is the average baseline HbA1c of the new patients you see with uncontrolled T2DM?
Among your diabetic patients, how many of them have the following complications? (Please give an answer in percent to each complication. They don't have to add up to 100%.)
In your practice, what is the most commonly encountered barrier to treatment of type T2DM? Please rank the following from most important to least important, with the most important barrier on top.

options.text: Lack of knowledge of the patient about their disease
Patient's personal beliefs and attitude towards diabetes
